Translations.Text: None shall have it except the wicked
The one who denies and turns away
As for the righteous, he will be spared it
The one who gives his money to purify
Seeking nothing in return
Except the face of His Lord, the Most High
And he will be pleased
By the late morning
And the night when it falls
Your Lord has not left you, nor did He forget you
And the Hereafter is better for you than the first
And your Lord will give you and you will be pleased
Did he not find you an orphan and He sheltered you
And He found you lost, and He guided you
And He found you in need, so He gave you riches
As for the orphan, you shall not make him sad
And as for the beggar, you shall not reprimand
And you shall proclaim the blessings from your Lord
Did We not comfort your chest
And take from you your load
Which had put strain on your back
And We have raised your remembrance
So with hardship comes ease
With hardship comes ease
So when you are done, then stand
And to your Lord you shall seek
